titleStmt.title: Mercurius alethes: or, An humble petition of the corrupt party, dissolved at Westminster, April 20. 1653. To the present power in being. Together with a former petition, penned in the yeer 1650 for the benefit of some publique and private friends, and delivered onely in a manuscript by the same author. Wherein is much truth acknowledged, as also 1 corruption. 2 Partiality. 3 Want of charity. 4 Insolency and pride. 5 A world of self-interest

notesStmt.note: "1 .. 5" on title page enclosed in brackets.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
